speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: SCENE I. Before OLIVIA's house.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Enter Clown and FABIAN

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Now, as thou lovest me, let me see his letter.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Good Master Fabian, grant me another request.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Any thing.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Do not desire to see this letter.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: This is, to give a dog, and in recompense desire my

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: dog again.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Enter DUKE ORSINO, VIOLA, CURIO, and Lords

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Belong you to the Lady Olivia, friends?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Ay, sir; we are some of her trappings.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: I know thee well; how dost thou, my good fellow?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Truly, sir, the better for my foes and the worse

speaker: Clown
text_entry: for my friends.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Just the contrary; the better for thy friends.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: No, sir, the worse.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: How can that be?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Marry, sir, they praise me and make an ass of me;

speaker: Clown
text_entry: now my foes tell me plainly I am an ass: so that by

speaker: Clown
text_entry: my foes, sir I profit in the knowledge of myself,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and by my friends, I am abused: so that,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: conclusions to be as kisses, if your four negatives

speaker: Clown
text_entry: make your two affirmatives why then, the worse for

speaker: Clown
text_entry: my friends and the better for my foes.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Why, this is excellent.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: By my troth, sir, no; though it please you to be

speaker: Clown
text_entry: one of my friends.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Thou shalt not be the worse for me: there's gold.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But that it would be double-dealing, sir, I would

speaker: Clown
text_entry: you could make it another.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: O, you give me ill counsel.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Put your grace in your pocket, sir, for this once,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and let your flesh and blood obey it.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Well, I will be so much a sinner, to be a

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: double-dealer: there's another.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Primo, secundo, tertio, is a good play; and the old

speaker: Clown
text_entry: saying is, the third pays for all: the triplex,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: sir, is a good tripping measure; or the bells of

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Saint Bennet, sir, may put you in mind; one, two, three.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: You can fool no more money out of me at this throw:

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: if you will let your lady know I am here to speak

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: with her, and bring her along with you, it may awake

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: my bounty further.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Marry, sir, lullaby to your bounty till I come

speaker: Clown
text_entry: again. I go, sir; but I would not have you to think

speaker: Clown
text_entry: that my desire of having is the sin of covetousness:

speaker: Clown
text_entry: but, as you say, sir, let your bounty take a nap, I

speaker: Clown
text_entry: will awake it anon.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Here comes the man, sir, that did rescue me.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Enter ANTONIO and Officers

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: That face of his I do remember well;

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Yet, when I saw it last, it was besmear'd

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: As black as Vulcan in the smoke of war:

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: A bawbling vessel was he captain of,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: For shallow draught and bulk unprizable;

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: With which such scathful grapple did he make

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: With the most noble bottom of our fleet,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: That very envy and the tongue of loss

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Cried fame and honour on him. What's the matter?

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: Orsino, this is that Antonio

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: That took the Phoenix and her fraught from Candy;

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: And this is he that did the Tiger board,

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: When your young nephew Titus lost his leg:

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: Here in the streets, desperate of shame and state,

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: In private brabble did we apprehend him.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: He did me kindness, sir, drew on my side;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: But in conclusion put strange speech upon me:

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I know not what 'twas but distraction.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Notable pirate! thou salt-water thief!

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: What foolish boldness brought thee to their mercies,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Whom thou, in terms so bloody and so dear,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Hast made thine enemies?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Orsino, noble sir,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Be pleased that I shake off these names you give me:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Antonio never yet was thief or pirate,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Though I confess, on base and ground enough,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Orsino's enemy. A witchcraft drew me hither:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: That most ingrateful boy there by your side,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: From the rude sea's enraged and foamy mouth

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Did I redeem; a wreck past hope he was:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: His life I gave him and did thereto add

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: My love, without retention or restraint,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: All his in dedication; for his sake

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Did I expose myself, pure for his love,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Into the danger of this adverse town;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Drew to defend him when he was beset:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Where being apprehended, his false cunning,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Not meaning to partake with me in danger,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Taught him to face me out of his acquaintance,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: And grew a twenty years removed thing

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: While one would wink; denied me mine own purse,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Which I had recommended to his use

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Not half an hour before.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: How can this be?

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: When came he to this town?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To-day, my lord; and for three months before,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: No interim, not a minute's vacancy,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Both day and night did we keep company.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Enter OLIVIA and Attendants

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Here comes the countess: now heaven walks on earth.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: But for thee, fellow; fellow, thy words are madness:

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Three months this youth hath tended upon me;

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: But more of that anon. Take him aside.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What would my lord, but that he may not have,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Wherein Olivia may seem serviceable?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Cesario, you do not keep promise with me.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Madam!

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Gracious Olivia,--

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What do you say, Cesario? Good my lord,--

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: My lord would speak; my duty hushes me.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: If it be aught to the old tune, my lord,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: It is as fat and fulsome to mine ear

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: As howling after music.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Still so cruel?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Still so constant, lord.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: What, to perverseness? you uncivil lady,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: To whose ingrate and unauspicious altars

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: My soul the faithfull'st offerings hath breathed out

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: That e'er devotion tender'd! What shall I do?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Even what it please my lord, that shall become him.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Why should I not, had I the heart to do it,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Like to the Egyptian thief at point of death,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Kill what I love?--a savage jealousy

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: That sometimes savours nobly. But hear me this:

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Since you to non-regardance cast my faith,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: And that I partly know the instrument

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: That screws me from my true place in your favour,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Live you the marble-breasted tyrant still;

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: But this your minion, whom I know you love,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: And whom, by heaven I swear, I tender dearly,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Him will I tear out of that cruel eye,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Where he sits crowned in his master's spite.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Come, boy, with me; my thoughts are ripe in mischief:

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: I'll sacrifice the lamb that I do love,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: To spite a raven's heart within a dove.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And I, most jocund, apt and willingly,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: To do you rest, a thousand deaths would die.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Where goes Cesario?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: After him I love

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: More than I love these eyes, more than my life,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: More, by all mores, than e'er I shall love wife.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: If I do feign, you witnesses above

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Punish my life for tainting of my love!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Ay me, detested! how am I beguiled!

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Who does beguile you? who does do you wrong?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Hast thou forgot thyself? is it so long?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Call forth the holy father.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Come, away!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Whither, my lord? Cesario, husband, stay.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Husband!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Ay, husband: can he that deny?

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Her husband, sirrah!

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: No, my lord, not I.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Alas, it is the baseness of thy fear

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: That makes thee strangle thy propriety:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Fear not, Cesario; take thy fortunes up;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Be that thou know'st thou art, and then thou art

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: As great as that thou fear'st.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Enter Priest

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: O, welcome, father!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Father, I charge thee, by thy reverence,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Here to unfold, though lately we intended

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: To keep in darkness what occasion now

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Reveals before 'tis ripe, what thou dost know

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Hath newly pass'd between this youth and me.

speaker: Priest
text_entry: A contract of eternal bond of love,

speaker: Priest
text_entry: Confirm'd by mutual joinder of your hands,

speaker: Priest
text_entry: Attested by the holy close of lips,

speaker: Priest
text_entry: Strengthen'd by interchangement of your rings;

speaker: Priest
text_entry: And all the ceremony of this compact

speaker: Priest
text_entry: Seal'd in my function, by my testimony:

speaker: Priest
text_entry: Since when, my watch hath told me, toward my grave

speaker: Priest
text_entry: I have travell'd but two hours.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: O thou dissembling cub! what wilt thou be

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: When time hath sow'd a grizzle on thy case?

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Or will not else thy craft so quickly grow,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: That thine own trip shall be thine overthrow?

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Farewell, and take her; but direct thy feet

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Where thou and I henceforth may never meet.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: My lord, I do protest--

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: O, do not swear!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Hold little faith, though thou hast too much fear.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Enter SIR ANDREW

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: For the love of God, a surgeon! Send one presently

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: to Sir Toby.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What's the matter?

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: He has broke my head across and has given Sir Toby

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: a bloody coxcomb too: for the love of God, your

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: help! I had rather than forty pound I were at home.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Who has done this, Sir Andrew?

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: The count's gentleman, one Cesario: we took him for

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: a coward, but he's the very devil incardinate.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: My gentleman, Cesario?

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: 'Od's lifelings, here he is! You broke my head for

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: nothing; and that that I did, I was set on to do't

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: by Sir Toby.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Why do you speak to me? I never hurt you:

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: You drew your sword upon me without cause;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: But I bespoke you fair, and hurt you not.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: If a bloody coxcomb be a hurt, you have hurt me: I

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: think you set nothing by a bloody coxcomb.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Enter SIR TOBY BELCH and Clown

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Here comes Sir Toby halting; you shall hear more:

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: but if he had not been in drink, he would have

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: tickled you othergates than he did.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: How now, gentleman! how is't with you?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: That's all one: has hurt me, and there's the end

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: on't. Sot, didst see Dick surgeon, sot?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: O, he's drunk, Sir Toby, an hour agone; his eyes

speaker: Clown
text_entry: were set at eight i' the morning.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Then he's a rogue, and a passy measures panyn: I

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: hate a drunken rogue.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Away with him! Who hath made this havoc with them?

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: I'll help you, Sir Toby, because well be dressed together.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Will you help? an ass-head and a coxcomb and a

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: knave, a thin-faced knave, a gull!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Get him to bed, and let his hurt be look'd to.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exeunt Clown, FABIAN, SIR TOBY BELCH, and SIR ANDREW

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Enter SEBASTIAN

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I am sorry, madam, I have hurt your kinsman:

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: But, had it been the brother of my blood,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I must have done no less with wit and safety.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: You throw a strange regard upon me, and by that

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I do perceive it hath offended you:

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Pardon me, sweet one, even for the vows

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: We made each other but so late ago.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: One face, one voice, one habit, and two persons,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: A natural perspective, that is and is not!

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Antonio, O my dear Antonio!

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: How have the hours rack'd and tortured me,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Since I have lost thee!

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Sebastian are you?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Fear'st thou that, Antonio?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: How have you made division of yourself?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: An apple, cleft in two, is not more twin

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Than these two creatures. Which is Sebastian?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Most wonderful!

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Do I stand there? I never had a brother;

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Nor can there be that deity in my nature,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Of here and every where. I had a sister,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Whom the blind waves and surges have devour'd.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Of charity, what kin are you to me?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: What countryman? what name? what parentage?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Of Messaline: Sebastian was my father;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Such a Sebastian was my brother too,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: So went he suited to his watery tomb:

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: If spirits can assume both form and suit

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: You come to fright us.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: A spirit I am indeed;

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: But am in that dimension grossly clad

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Which from the womb I did participate.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Were you a woman, as the rest goes even,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I should my tears let fall upon your cheek,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: And say 'Thrice-welcome, drowned Viola!'

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: My father had a mole upon his brow.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: And so had mine.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And died that day when Viola from her birth

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Had number'd thirteen years.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: O, that record is lively in my soul!

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: He finished indeed his mortal act

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: That day that made my sister thirteen years.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: If nothing lets to make us happy both

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: But this my masculine usurp'd attire,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Do not embrace me till each circumstance

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Of place, time, fortune, do cohere and jump

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: That I am Viola: which to confirm,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I'll bring you to a captain in this town,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Where lie my maiden weeds; by whose gentle help

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I was preserved to serve this noble count.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: All the occurrence of my fortune since

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Hath been between this lady and this lord.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: [To OLIVIA]  So comes it, lady, you have been mistook:

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: But nature to her bias drew in that.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: You would have been contracted to a maid;

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Nor are you therein, by my life, deceived,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: You are betroth'd both to a maid and man.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Be not amazed; right noble is his blood.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: If this be so, as yet the glass seems true,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: I shall have share in this most happy wreck.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: To VIOLA

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Boy, thou hast said to me a thousand times

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Thou never shouldst love woman like to me.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And all those sayings will I overswear;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And those swearings keep as true in soul

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: As doth that orbed continent the fire

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: That severs day from night.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Give me thy hand;

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: And let me see thee in thy woman's weeds.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: The captain that did bring me first on shore

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Hath my maid's garments: he upon some action

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Is now in durance, at Malvolio's suit,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: A gentleman, and follower of my lady's.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: He shall enlarge him: fetch Malvolio hither:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And yet, alas, now I remember me,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: They say, poor gentleman, he's much distract.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Re-enter Clown with a letter, and FABIAN

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: A most extracting frenzy of mine own

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: From my remembrance clearly banish'd his.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: How does he, sirrah?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Truly, madam, he holds Belzebub at the staves's end as

speaker: Clown
text_entry: well as a man in his case may do: has here writ a

speaker: Clown
text_entry: letter to you; I should have given't you to-day

speaker: Clown
text_entry: morning, but as a madman's epistles are no gospels,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: so it skills not much when they are delivered.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Open't, and read it.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Look then to be well edified when the fool delivers

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the madman.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Reads

speaker: Clown
text_entry: 'By the Lord, madam,'--

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: How now! art thou mad?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: No, madam, I do but read madness: an your ladyship

speaker: Clown
text_entry: will have it as it ought to be, you must allow Vox.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Prithee, read i' thy right wits.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: So I do, madonna; but to read his right wits is to

speaker: Clown
text_entry: read thus: therefore perpend, my princess, and give ear.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Read it you, sirrah.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: To FABIAN

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: [Reads]  'By the Lord, madam, you wrong me, and the

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: world shall know it: though you have put me into

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: darkness and given your drunken cousin rule over

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: me, yet have I the benefit of my senses as well as

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: your ladyship. I have your own letter that induced

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: me to the semblance I put on; with the which I doubt

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: not but to do myself much right, or you much shame.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Think of me as you please. I leave my duty a little

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: unthought of and speak out of my injury.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: THE MADLY-USED MALVOLIO.'

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Did he write this?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Ay, madam.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: This savours not much of distraction.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: See him deliver'd, Fabian; bring him hither.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exit FABIAN

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: My lord so please you, these things further

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: thought on,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: To think me as well a sister as a wife,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: One day shall crown the alliance on't, so please you,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Here at my house and at my proper cost.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Madam, I am most apt to embrace your offer.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: To VIOLA

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Your master quits you; and for your service done him,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: So much against the mettle of your sex,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: So far beneath your soft and tender breeding,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: And since you call'd me master for so long,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Here is my hand: you shall from this time be

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Your master's mistress.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: A sister! you are she.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Re-enter FABIAN, with MALVOLIO

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Is this the madman?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Ay, my lord, this same.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: How now, Malvolio!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Madam, you have done me wrong,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Notorious wrong.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Have I, Malvolio? no.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Lady, you have. Pray you, peruse that letter.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: You must not now deny it is your hand:

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Write from it, if you can, in hand or phrase;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Or say 'tis not your seal, nor your invention:

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: You can say none of this: well, grant it then

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: And tell me, in the modesty of honour,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Why you have given me such clear lights of favour,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Bade me come smiling and cross-garter'd to you,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: To put on yellow stockings and to frown

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Upon Sir Toby and the lighter people;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: And, acting this in an obedient hope,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Why have you suffer'd me to be imprison'd,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Kept in a dark house, visited by the priest,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: And made the most notorious geck and gull

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: That e'er invention play'd on? tell me why.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Alas, Malvolio, this is not my writing,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Though, I confess, much like the character

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: But out of question 'tis Maria's hand.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And now I do bethink me, it was she

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: First told me thou wast mad; then camest in smiling,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And in such forms which here were presupposed

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Upon thee in the letter. Prithee, be content:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: This practise hath most shrewdly pass'd upon thee;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: But when we know the grounds and authors of it,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Thou shalt be both the plaintiff and the judge

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Of thine own cause.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Good madam, hear me speak,

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: And let no quarrel nor no brawl to come

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Taint the condition of this present hour,

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Which I have wonder'd at. In hope it shall not,

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Most freely I confess, myself and Toby

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Set this device against Malvolio here,

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Upon some stubborn and uncourteous parts

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: We had conceived against him: Maria writ

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: The letter at Sir Toby's great importance;

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: In recompense whereof he hath married her.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: How with a sportful malice it was follow'd,

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: May rather pluck on laughter than revenge;

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: If that the injuries be justly weigh'd

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: That have on both sides pass'd.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Alas, poor fool, how have they baffled thee!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Why, 'some are born great, some achieve greatness,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and some have greatness thrown upon them.' I was

speaker: Clown
text_entry: one, sir, in this interlude; one Sir Topas, sir; but

speaker: Clown
text_entry: that's all one. 'By the Lord, fool, I am not mad.'

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But do you remember? 'Madam, why laugh you at such

speaker: Clown
text_entry: a barren rascal? an you smile not, he's gagged:'

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and thus the whirligig of time brings in his revenges.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I'll be revenged on the whole pack of you.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: He hath been most notoriously abused.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Pursue him and entreat him to a peace:

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: He hath not told us of the captain yet:

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: When that is known and golden time convents,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: A solemn combination shall be made

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Of our dear souls. Meantime, sweet sister,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: We will not part from hence. Cesario, come;

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: For so you shall be, while you are a man;

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: But when in other habits you are seen,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Orsino's mistress and his fancy's queen.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Exeunt all, except Clown

speaker: Clown
text_entry: [Sings]

speaker: Clown
text_entry: When that I was and a little tiny boy,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: A foolish thing was but a toy,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: For the rain it raineth every day.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But when I came to man's estate,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With hey, ho,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: 'Gainst knaves and thieves men shut their gate,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: For the rain,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But when I came, alas! to wive,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With hey, ho,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: By swaggering could I never thrive,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: For the rain,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But when I came unto my beds,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With hey, ho,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With toss-pots still had drunken heads,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: For the rain,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: A great while ago the world begun,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With hey, ho,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But that's all one, our play is done,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: And we'll strive to please you every day.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit
